Title: Business Intelligence Analyst (all genders) Full Time, Berlin
Description:
Here at BARFER’S we love pets and want to revolutionize the pet food market.

With a selection of over 280 premium products developed and produced in-house in Berlin, we are already setting new standards to promote the health and well-being in the pet care market. Whether through our online shop or one of our eight stores in Berlin, Potsdam, and Hamburg, we make BARF accessible to everyone who wants the very best for their animals. BARF stands for biologically appropriate raw food and has been around since 1993.

This vision drives our team of more than 100 employees every single day. Together, we are making a lasting impact on the pet care industry – and we’re continuing to grow.

Join our pack and help us actively shape the future of the pet care market!

Here at BARFERs we want to build the e-commerce organization of the future, where data drives all our decision-making. To drive this vision you will design processes, define KPIs, build dashboards, and design predictive models to inform business and product decisions. In this role, you drive data solutions at scale by being the primary partner to our Commercial, Marketing and IT Teams.

Using your technical skills, business acumen, and creativity, you will build automated data solutions that provide tactical and strategic insights. As a Business Intelligence Analyst, you will combine technology and innovation to organize data, enable insights and create the world’s most data-driven and efficient organization. You will lead complex, multi-disciplinary projects using your analytics, visualization, and data warehousing expertise, manage project schedules, identifying risks, and communicating them with clarity to project stakeholders. You're equally versed at explaining your team's analyses to executives as you are discussing the technical trade-offs in product development with engineers.

Aufgaben


Partner closely with the Marketing and Commercial teams, understand their data needs, and address those with intelligent data solutions in a timely, scalable and sustainable fashion.
Partner with our Data Engineering and Technical BI teams to enhance data infrastructure, data availability, and broad access to commercial and financial insights made available through self-service Power BI/Looker dashboards.
Solve complex business problems through understandable statistical solutions, enabling the business to make better decisions and complete their responsibilities more efficiently.
Work closely with each department head to conduct business and financial analysis, including pricing, forecasting and monitoring of key business activity.
Identify data points and proactively develop new metrics and analysis.
Implement Machine Learning and Predictive Modeling algorithms to support automated forecasting.


Qualifikation


E-commerce experience is a must.
Experience working in a high-paced environment.
Open, entrepreneurial mindset with the ability to build trust and partnerships easily.
You like to work in ambiguous environments and are not afraid to try and learn.
You are a self-starter that takes ownership: You always help, no matter your job description.
You are hands-on and always keep the long-term goals as a priority.
You have a degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Finance and/or other quantitative fields.
3+ years of experience in Analytics or Business Intelligence, performing quantitative analysis in a commercial context.
You’re skilled at querying and building databases (SQL, Big Query) and have proven experience building data visualizations with e.g.: Power BI, Power Pivot or Looker.
You have gained first experience with Python or other relevant scripting languages.
You can explain technical concepts and analysis implications clearly to a wide audience, including senior executives, and be able to translate business objectives into actionable analyses.
Advanced Microsoft Excel skills are preferred.


Benefits


Competitive compensation package depending on your experience.
30 days of vacation per year – plus an extra day off on your birthday, just for you!
An exciting opportunity to join a well-funded and fast-growing German e-commerce start-up, where you can help build and shape the company from the ground up!
Fast-moving, ambitious & entrepreneurial culture, strong career development, and growth opportunities.
We’re dog-friendly! Bring your dog along to work.


Sounds exciting?

Apply now! We can’t wait to get to know you!

At BARFERs we value a diverse and inclusive workplace, and we believe it is the key to innovation and happy employees. BARFERs is committed to providing an open, friendly, safe, and welcoming environment for every employee. We are delighted to receive applications from diverse candidates including gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, disability, physical appearance, body size, race, ethnicity, age, and religious beliefs

BARFERs does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our job’s alias, BARFERs employees or any other organization location. BARFERs will not be responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.
Show more

  • Partner with our Data Engineering and Technical BI teams to enhance data infrastructure, data availability, and broad access to commercial and financial insights made available through self-service Power BI/Looker dashboards.
  • Solve complex business problems through understandable statistical solutions, enabling the business to make better decisions and complete their responsibilities more efficiently.
  • Work closely with each department head to conduct business and financial analysis, including pricing, forecasting and monitoring of key business activity.
  • Identify data points and proactively develop new metrics and analysis.
  • Implement Machine Learning and Predictive Modeling algorithms to support automated forecasting.

Qualifikation

  • E-commerce experience is a must.
  • Experience working in a high-paced environment.
  • Open, entrepreneurial mindset with the ability to build trust and partnerships easily.
  • You like to work in ambiguous environments and are not afraid to try and learn.
  • You are a self-starter that takes ownership: You always help, no matter your job description.
  • You are hands-on and always keep the long-term goals as a priority.
  • You have a degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Finance and/or other quantitative fields.
  • 3+ years of experience in Analytics or Business Intelligence, performing quantitative analysis in a commercial context.
  • You’re skilled at querying and building databases (SQL, Big Query) and have proven experience building data visualizations with e.g.: Power BI, Power Pivot or Looker.
  • You have gained first experience with Python or other relevant scripting languages.
  • You can explain technical concepts and analysis implications clearly to a wide audience, including senior executives, and be able to translate business objectives into actionable analyses.
  • Advanced Microsoft Excel skills are preferred.

Benefits

  • Competitive compensation package depending on your experience.
  • 30 days of vacation per year – plus an extra day off on your birthday, just for you!
  • An exciting opportunity to join a well-funded and fast-growing German e-commerce start-up, where you can help build and shape the company from the ground up!
  • Fast-moving, ambitious & entrepreneurial culture, strong career development, and growth opportunities.
  • We’re dog-friendly! Bring your dog along to work.

Sounds exciting?

Apply now! We can’t wait to get to know you!

At BARFERs we value a diverse and inclusive workplace, and we believe it is the key to innovation and happy employees. BARFERs is committed to providing an open, friendly, safe, and welcoming environment for every employee. We are delighted to receive applications from diverse candidates including gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, disability, physical appearance, body size, race, ethnicity, age, and religious beliefs

BARFERs does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our job’s alias, BARFERs employees or any other organization location. BARFERs will not be responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Title: Product Analyst (All levels)
Description:
THE ROLE & THE TEAM

Data is a critical part of our product development process and we are the chief advocates for its quality and usage. We are looking for a Principal Product Analyst (f/m/d) who can quickly jump in, understand, evaluate, recommend, and make an impact on the digital experiences on Zalando for customers.

You will be working in an exciting team focused on delivering a tailored discovery experience to our customers via great personalization, recommendation, browse and search experiences. Working closely with teams of Product Managers, Software Engineers, Applied Scientists, and Business Leaders, you will be leading data-explorations, A/B tests, hypothesis analysis, and other statistical approaches focused on understanding the products and the customers, as well as the continuous reporting and monitoring of critical business KPIs.

In addition, you will benefit from a network of Product Analysts, who share similar challenges across the company, to learn and develop your skills.

INCLUSIVE BY DESIGN

At Zalando, our vision is to be the starting point for fashion - one that is inclusive by design. We only assess candidates based on qualifications, merit, and business needs. We welcome applications from people of all gender identities, sexual orientations, personal expressions, racial identities, ethnicities, religious beliefs, and disability statuses. We only want to know why you’re great for this role, so please avoid including your picture, age, and marital status in your CV as well.

We want to provide you with a great candidate experience. Please feel free to inform us of any accommodations you may need, so we can best support and assist you throughout the hiring process.

do.BETTER - our diversity & inclusion strategy https //corporate.zalando.com/en/diversity-inclusion

Our employee resource groups https //corporate.zalando.com/en/diversity-inclusion/our-employee-resource-groups

WHAT WE’D LOVE YOU TO DO (AND LOVE DOING)



Create a strategy, align with key partners, generate insights, deliver analysis, and deliver ongoing improvements independently for an ambiguous problem.
Develop in-depth analytical (user) understanding of what drives growth for the product and how it can be improved.
Be a data explorer, an educator, and a partner in decision making.
Challenge and contribute to product decisions based on your insights
Give (analytical) evidence supporting business decisions - investments, roll-out, and/or additional deep-dives.
Define the key performance metrics for the teams to judge and monitor product performance.
Advise in the set-up of A/B Tests or other quasi-experiments for new features and business opportunities, analysing, and deep-diving into the results to give recommendations.
Serve as an interface between data stakeholders across the organization to ensure alignment, communication, and understanding of data products and analyses.



WE'D LOVE TO MEET YOU IF



You have 5+ years of relevant working experience in a data-intensive analytics role where you learned how to work with raw data, such as in Digital Analytics, Product Analytics, or Business Intelligence, preferably in e-commerce.
You have a strong knowledge of e-commerce KPIs and how they can be defined.
You have a strong knowledge of SQL, and you are comfortable working with nested/repeated data.
Strong knowledge of advanced analytics and statistical software languages (preferably Python), particularly regarding data clean up and manipulation. Familiarity with statistical models and prediction is a plus.
You have a strong knowledge of A/B testing best practices and/or quasi-experimental analysis methodologies.
You are very comfortable working with onsite user behaviour data, from defining tracking specifications that capture relevant user actions to generating insights from the data (for example using Google Analytics or a similar service).
You have strong communication skills and the ability to explain processes, choices, and insights to stakeholders across all levels of seniority and technical background.



OUR OFFER

Zalando provides a range of benefits, here’s an overview of what you can expect. Ask your Talent Acquisition Partner to learn more about what we offer.



Employee shares program
40% off fashion and beauty products sold and shipped by Zalando, 30% off Zalando Lounge, discounts from external partners
2 paid volunteering days a year
Hybrid working model with 60% (or more) remote per week, actual practice is up to each team to best support their collaboration
Work from abroad for up to 30 working days a year
27 days of vacation a year to start
Relocation assistance available (subject to prior agreement)
Family services, including counselling and support
Health and wellbeing options (including Gympass)
Mental health support and coaching available
If you think you have what it takes, we encourage you to apply even if you don't meet every single requirement. You may just be the right candidate for this or other roles!



If you think you have what it takes, we encourage you to apply even if you don't meet every single requirement. You may just be the right candidate for this or other roles!

Title: Marketing Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
As a Marketing BI Analyst (m/f/d) in the Global Digital Marketing & Sales Operations Team, you will be primarily responsible for generating and preparing data-driven insights for our marketing, service, and sales activities. By aggregating, analyzing, and visualizing data from various sources, you will play a key role in optimizing our customer journey, enhancing the efficiency of our marketing and lead generation campaigns, improving call center management processes, and supporting strategic decision-making.




Your impact

Conducting customer journey analyses using Global Digital Marketing data to identify trends and derive actionable recommendations.
Developing, maintaining, and optimizing dashboards and reports in Power BI and Google Sheets for KPI visualization and monitoring.
Automating and optimizing data processes while ensuring data quality using Python, SQL, and Databricks.
Supporting central and global marketing teams with planning, forecasting, and ongoing monitoring of their target KPIs.
Creating country-specific analyses to drive growth and optimize the use of digital marketing channels in individual markets.
Collaborating closely with the Data Engineering and Data Science teams within Viessmann IT.
Preparing results in the form of presentations, reports, and summaries for relevant stakeholders.




Who you are

A completed degree in business administration, economics, data science, or a comparable analytical field.
Several years of professional experience in business intelligence, data analytics, CRM, or a similar analytical area.
Strong analytical skills and knowledge of statistics and data modeling.
Extensive experience with tools like Power BI, Google Data Studio, Databricks, and ideally Python, SQL, or similar technologies.
Experience in analyzing CRM, call center, and/or performance marketing data.
Ability to effectively prepare and present complex data in an understandable and impactful way.
Independent, structured working style and enjoyment of working in an international, cross-functional team.
Language skills in German and English (at least Level B2).




Even if you don't fulfill all of the above but are ready to take this challenge on as a next step, go ahead and press “Apply” anyway. We love your spirit!




What makes us special

Our employees are the key to make our vision come alive. With that in mind, we‘ve created a range of perks for our employees:

A permanent position awaits you at our business where new technologies meet a modern workplace culture.
Viessmann Climate Solutions offers 30 days of paid vacation a year.
Once you join Viessmann, you can refer other great candidates and receive a referral bonus if they are hired.
Enjoy cool exclusive discounts on selected Viessmann Climate Solutions products and services.
Need a quick energy boost? Free healthy snacks and drinks are provided for you.
For a healthier community: Our health program offers easy access to coaching and therapy for our employees and their families.
Whether commuting by Job Bike or travelling by Europcar - our partnerships will protect the environment and your wallet.
The Viessmann academy and external partners offer a wide range of professional and personal training opportunities.
Whenever possible, Viessmann offers the option of mobile working and also provides the needed technical equipment.
Celebrate and have a great time with your co-workers at our individualized events, like our monthly breakfast or other team events.
Our flexible working hours allow you to balance your work and private life.
Daycare center or school closed? No problem! Your child will find toys and enough space to play-- and you have a fully equipped workplace to work in our child-parent room.




Who we are

We are Viessmann Climate Solutions. Founded in 1917 as a heating technology manufacturer, and now part of Carrier, we are today one of the world's leading providers of efficient and systemic climate and renewable energy solutions. We cover all applications: heating, cooling, ventilation, water and air quality, energy generation, and energy storage for the residential and commercial sector.




Our integrated solution offering seamlessly connects products and systems via digital platforms and services to a holistic climate and energy solution, thus creating a safe and reliable feel-good climate for our users. All activities are driven by our company purpose, "We create living spaces for generations to come" and our employees are passionate about playing an active role in the energy transition. Join us on this exciting journey now.

Show more

Title: Senior Business Intelligence Analyst (f/m/d)
Description:
Company Description

At Enpal, we are pursuing the dream of building the largest renewable community in Europe. How do we make that happen? Enpal finally simplifies providing solar energy: We rent out solar systems, electricity storage, and wall boxes at an all-inclusive rate, supplemented by a favorable green electricity tariff; all intelligently connected to form an integrated overall solution. True to the motto "digital, decentralized, and 100% renewable", our heart beats both for the rapid development of a company and for combating the greatest challenge of our generation - climate change.

Qualifications

What you should bring:


5+ years of relevant experience as Senior BI Analyst, Senior Business Analyst or Data Analyst.
High proficiency in SQL, ETL processes, and familiarity with BI tools like Tableau, Power BI, or similar. Our tech stack includes dbt, Snowflake, Streamlit and Tableau.
Exposure to Python (e.g. pandas) and Excel for quick a-hoc data analysis.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a proven track record of using data to improve business outcomes.
Enthusiasm for working in dynamic, rapidly changing environments, with a commitment to operational excellence and innovation.



Additional Information

We're offering:


The chance to be part of a fast-growing and future-oriented startup: we are one of the biggest players in the solar business.
Help to make the world a bit better: we are all about green energy.
Work with the best in the industry and grow with us: there’s plenty of room for your ideas.
A hybrid work model, the ability to come to our Berlin office every now and then for in person discussions and events, or to be there all the time - you decide.



At Enpal, we are proud of the diversity of our team. No decisions are made based on skin color, religion or religious belief, ethnic or national origin, nationality, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, or age, either during recruitment or employment. We strongly encourage women, neurodivergent people, people of color, and LGBTQ(+) people to apply. Enpal stands for a safe workplace and takes action against discrimination and harassment of any kind.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
The Company

Payrails is an innovative technology company with a team that has many years of experience in the payment industry and a real-life understanding of the merchants’ needs. We have seen the complexity firsthand and we have learned from all the challenges we've faced. Now we want to help leading technology companies around the world accept payments and build financial services with minimal upfront investments.

Our vision at Payrails is to reimagine payments. We do this by removing heavy reliance on Engineering efforts using composable building blocks that put the control firmly in the hands of our customers. We exist to help our customers become more productive and flexible, impacting directly on their ability to grow.

We are joined in our mission by top-tier investors Andreessen Horowitz, HV Capital, EQT and General Catalyst alongside a great cast of knowledgeable angel investors to enable us to solve the growing complexity of payments.

At Payrails, we are committed to building a team full of the most talented people. Excellence is part of our values and we understand that in order to achieve this, we need to build an environment where skilled people can work openly, collaboratively, and with the utmost trust in one another. We believe people thrive the most when they are fully aware of what the business is trying to achieve, why it is important to the market, and what challenges lie in the way to reaching our goals. In such an environment we believe people can truly excel, grow and enjoy working together. We try hard to be a company where everyone is inspired and feels a sense of responsibility to do the right thing to help us bring our vision to life. Succeeding with us is about finding solutions to the most pressing problems and executing them effectively.

Your Team

At Payrails, our Data team empowers all teams to uncover insights and transform them into actions that enhance the value and impact of our products and solutions. We champion data-enabled decision-making and recognize the importance of using the data as a tool to make optimal decisions.

What You Will Be Doing


You will develop and optimize reports, perform ad-hoc and deep-dive analyses to facilitate data-driven decision making.
You will improve and maintain our reporting data models, enabling self-service analytics across the company..
You will gain insights from the data and utilize them to enhance internal functions performance.
You will work in a highly effective team focusing on increasing the value and impact of our products.


You'll be great for this role if


You have more than 7 years of professional experience in Analytics, Business Intelligence or other related fields.
You have strong SQL skills, and have worked with GoodData, Tableau, Looker, or other Business Intelligence tools.
You have a solid knowledge of statistical techniques: distributions, statistical testing, regression, multivariate testing, etc.
You have experience in data analysis and can handle confidently large datasets
You have a good understanding of data modeling.
You are fluent in English and have excellent communication skills (both with technical and business teams).
Strong analytical and natural curiosity with a desire to explore new ideas, concepts, and ways to improve.
Proactive approach, taking initiative to anticipate needs and drive results independently.


Why You should join Payrails


You can truly create your own path by taking responsibility and implementing your own ideas
We offer visa and relocation support to you and your family where required
We offer a hybrid working environment
You have 27 annual vacation days + 1 day of paid birthday leave for you to have fun and party without any worries!
We get together regularly for team lunches and events
You help us shape the future of payments


At Payrails, we prioritize a culture of inclusivity and diversity, evaluating candidates solely based on their skills and potential, regardless of age, gender, identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion. We welcome applications from individuals of all backgrounds and identities. In line with our commitment to fairness, we kindly request applicants to refrain from including personal details such as a picture, age, or marital status in their CVs.
Show more

Title: Lead Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
Berlin, London, Remote

________________________

Hello 👋 I am Puneet, Co- founder and CPO at Kayzen, and I am now looking for a Lead Data Analyst who will be a part of the our Data Analytics ( Data ) team. 🙌

But wait, you have not heard of Kayzen before? 😃

Kayzen is a mobile demand-side platform (DSP) dedicated to democratizing programmatic advertising. We enable leading apps, agencies, media buyers, and brands to run programmatic customer acquisition, retargeting, and brand performance campaigns through its self-serve and managed service options.

Built on the three core pillars of performance, transparency, and control, Kayzen powers the world's best mobile marketing teams with bespoke solutions that fuel business growth and deliver a competitive advantage.

With an unprecedented scale of 160B+ daily ad requests from 1.6B+ unique users worldwide, we serve up to 1B+ ads per day in 180 countries. Kayzen is accessible through our APIs and user interface.

The role

As the Lead Data Analyst, you will ensure that the Data Analytics team consistently applies advanced descriptive, prescriptive, and predictive analytics to deliver high-value insights across multiple stakeholders. At Kayzen, our Data Analytics team operates within the broader "Data Team," which also includes Data Science and Machine Learning Engineering. Collectively, the Data Team develops and deploys the machine learning models that power our clients' advertising performance in the programmatic ecosystem.

Within this structure, the Data Analytics team serves as a critical bridge between the Data Team and the broader business units (e.g., campaign managers, business owners, product managers).

Through your leadership, you will champion a data-driven culture and empower teams across Kayzen to harness analytical insights in a consistent and impactful way.

Responsibilities

As a hands-on leader, you will combine technical prowess with strategic vision—driving complex analysis, mentoring team members, and tackling data challenges directly. You will address a variety of problems, such as feature engineering, A/B testing, fraud detection, bidding decisions to name a few examples. Your key responsibilities include:


Team Leadership & Mentorship: Guide and develop the Data Analytics team, ensuring the quality and impact of their deliverables.
Roadmap Definition: Shape both the Data Analytics roadmap and the broader Data Team roadmap, making decisions that align with business priorities and objectives.
Data-Driven Model Research: Provide in-depth research to inform machine learning model development, leveraging both internal and external data sources to generate actionable insights.
Analytical & Statistical Expertise: Serve as the primary source of rigorous analytics for various data problems, evaluating system performance , finding performance issues and devising solutions for them
Data Accessibility & Quality Control: Facilitate data access throughout the organization while maintaining a centralized oversight to guarantee data quality.


What this role is not about:


This is not a typical BI role, where you are just expected to receive requirements and build dashboards. At Kayzen, the Data Analyst role is more investigative and we need people capable to ask questions and to answer them.
This is not a campaign management role, where you will be responsible for operational campaign optimization.


Requirements


5+ years of experience in the Ad-Tech industry, working in Data Analytics or related fields;
SQL (advanced);
Python (intermediate);
Expertise in data mining, processing, modeling and data visualization and strong analytical skills;
A results-driven, hands-on mindset that combines rapid experimentation, pragmatic problem-solving, and a passion for delivering exceptional customer-focused solutions;
High level of proactiveness and eagerness to solve issues;
A strong sense of ownership and strong work ethics;
Experience with Big Data technologies (Spark, HDFS, Hive, etc) is a plus;
Experience with Git and Airflow is a plus.


What do we offer?


Reporting directly to Co-founder & CPO
Direct access to top management and an extremely "visible" role
Exceptional career growth and learning opportunity
A unique opportunity to be part of an experienced team of industry experts and entrepreneurs who bring massive change to the Adtech market
Direct, day-to-day work experience with the management
A fun, driven, and multinational team located across Germany, India, UK, Argentina, Ukraine, Turkey, Spain and many more countries
A flexible work-from-home arrangement
A 500-dollar home-office setup budget
A 1000-dollar annual learning and development budget
Show more

Berlin, London, Remote

________________________

Hello 👋 I am Puneet, Co- founder and CPO at Kayzen, and I am now looking for a Lead Data Analyst who will be a part of the our Data Analytics ( Data ) team. 🙌

But wait, you have not heard of Kayzen before? 😃

Kayzen is a mobile demand-side platform (DSP) dedicated to democratizing programmatic advertising. We enable leading apps, agencies, media buyers, and brands to run programmatic customer acquisition, retargeting, and brand performance campaigns through its self-serve and managed service options.

Built on the three core pillars of performance, transparency, and control, Kayzen powers the world's best mobile marketing teams with bespoke solutions that fuel business growth and deliver a competitive advantage.

With an unprecedented scale of 160B+ daily ad requests from 1.6B+ unique users worldwide, we serve up to 1B+ ads per day in 180 countries. Kayzen is accessible through our APIs and user interface.

The role

As the Lead Data Analyst, you will ensure that the Data Analytics team consistently applies advanced descriptive, prescriptive, and predictive analytics to deliver high-value insights across multiple stakeholders. At Kayzen, our Data Analytics team operates within the broader "Data Team," which also includes Data Science and Machine Learning Engineering. Collectively, the Data Team develops and deploys the machine learning models that power our clients' advertising performance in the programmatic ecosystem.

Within this structure, the Data Analytics team serves as a critical bridge between the Data Team and the broader business units (e.g., campaign managers, business owners, product managers).

Through your leadership, you will champion a data-driven culture and empower teams across Kayzen to harness analytical insights in a consistent and impactful way.

Responsibilities

As a hands-on leader, you will combine technical prowess with strategic vision—driving complex analysis, mentoring team members, and tackling data challenges directly. You will address a variety of problems, such as feature engineering, A/B testing, fraud detection, bidding decisions to name a few examples. Your key responsibilities include:

  • Team Leadership & Mentorship: Guide and develop the Data Analytics team, ensuring the quality and impact of their deliverables.
  • Roadmap Definition: Shape both the Data Analytics roadmap and the broader Data Team roadmap, making decisions that align with business priorities and objectives.
  • Data-Driven Model Research: Provide in-depth research to inform machine learning model development, leveraging both internal and external data sources to generate actionable insights.
  • Analytical & Statistical Expertise: Serve as the primary source of rigorous analytics for various data problems, evaluating system performance , finding performance issues and devising solutions for them
  • Data Accessibility & Quality Control: Facilitate data access throughout the organization while maintaining a centralized oversight to guarantee data quality.

What this role is not about:

  • This is not a typical BI role, where you are just expected to receive requirements and build dashboards. At Kayzen, the Data Analyst role is more investigative and we need people capable to ask questions and to answer them.
  • This is not a campaign management role, where you will be responsible for operational campaign optimization.

Requirements

  • 5+ years of experience in the Ad-Tech industry, working in Data Analytics or related fields;
  • SQL (advanced);
  • Python (intermediate);
  • Expertise in data mining, processing, modeling and data visualization and strong analytical skills;
  • A results-driven, hands-on mindset that combines rapid experimentation, pragmatic problem-solving, and a passion for delivering exceptional customer-focused solutions;
  • High level of proactiveness and eagerness to solve issues;
  • A strong sense of ownership and strong work ethics;
  • Experience with Big Data technologies (Spark, HDFS, Hive, etc) is a plus;
  • Experience with Git and Airflow is a plus.

What do we offer?

  • Reporting directly to Co-founder & CPO
  • Direct access to top management and an extremely "visible" role
  • Exceptional career growth and learning opportunity
  • A unique opportunity to be part of an experienced team of industry experts and entrepreneurs who bring massive change to the Adtech market
  • Direct, day-to-day work experience with the management
  • A fun, driven, and multinational team located across Germany, India, UK, Argentina, Ukraine, Turkey, Spain and many more countries
  • A flexible work-from-home arrangement
  • A 500-dollar home-office setup budget
  • A 1000-dollar annual learning and development budget

Title: Data Analyst (0 Experience Required)
Description:
For thousands of years, maps have provided humans with the knowledge they need to make decisions. As a Maps Evaluator, you will have the opportunity to provide ground truth for your town, city or country.




At Peroptyx, we are looking for Data Analysts who will review mapping data for digital mapping applications. Your research capabilities will validate and ensure that the navigation of certain routes are accurate and safe.




As part of this role you will verify that business names and opening hours are correct. You will check that the distance from a starting point to an end destination is listed accurately resulting in better user experiences.




With this job you can plan your days around this highly flexible working schedule, work weekends or late evenings, all from the comfort of your own office. The flexibility of our roles minimizes the impact on your daily routine.




So, whether you are a student looking to earn as you learn, a retiree looking for a new challenge a part-time/full time professional or a work from home parent, Peroptyx has the right role for you!




Benefits

Work up to 20 hours per week.
Earn a competitive rate of pay.
Develop your research skills.
Avoid the long commute.
Work from the comfort of your home office.
Enjoy the flexibility of setting your own working hours!




Ideal Candidate

Fluent in English and German.
Excellent research skills.
Excellent local knowledge of your home country.
Good understanding and general knowledge of the geography and culture of Germany.
Analytical mindset.




Job Requirements

Must be living in Germany for a minimum of 5 consecutive years.
Must pass an online open-book exam that can verify your full understanding of the material and concepts.
Must be willing to work a minimum of 10 hours and up to 20 hours per week depending on task availability.
Good working knowledge of search engines, map applications and familiarity with social media platforms.
Strong ability to learn, understand and apply multiple sets of different instructions.
All work must be of an independent nature.







Apply Online Today!

Title: Staff Data Analyst
Description:
About GetYourGuide

GetYourGuide is the globally leading marketplace for unforgettable travel experiences. Travelers use GetYourGuide to discover the best things to do in a destination. Since its founding in 2009, travelers from over 170 countries have booked more than 150 million tours, activities, and attraction tickets through GetYourGuide. Powered by a global team of over 700 travel experts and technologists, we are headquartered in Berlin and have 17 local offices around the world. Visit our careers website to learn more.

Team mission

The Analytics team's mission is to enable the organisation to take action based on data. We work on a variety of problems and datasets as members of cross-functional mission teams. We take ownership of the entire analytics funnel, from exploration through recommendations to impact measurement, and take pride in the insights we generate.

You Will


Develop quantitative analysis to initiate and drive business decisions focusing on supply strategy
Help the supply business and tech teams learn about their features by designing and analyzing Experiments.
Design and implement metrics, dashboards, and reports to guide the teams’ strategy and success.
Support the technical teams in tracking and producing more insightful data.
Contribute to the learning and experimentation culture of the company by promoting hypothesis-driven product and operational development and evaluation.


Who You Are


8+ years of relevant experience interpreting data in an analytics, data science or business intelligence role
Ability to collaborate with multiple teams to drive strategic decisions and execute on them
Strong project management skills
Strong knowledge of SQL and knowledge of Python
Experience with data visualization and reporting tools (e.g. Looker, Jupyter Notebooks)
Curiosity and reasoning skills with proven evidence of problem-solving.
Ability to understand user behavior and meaning behind the numbers
Desire to work in an international environment, with minimal direction and with highly engaged individuals
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English


Nice To Have


Previous experience working with agile product teams is a plus.
Experienced with the statistics and assumptions of experimentation.
Familiarity with ETL technologies like Airflow is a plus.
Experience with big data tools (e.g. Spark, Hive) is a plus


How We Set You Up For Success


Meaningful work that helps create memorable travel experiences
A diverse, inclusive environment where your voice is valued
Collaboration with smart, engaged colleagues from over 80 nationalities
English-speaking office environment
Continuous learning opportunities through monthly Hackathons, weekly tech talks, and an annual external training budget
Mentorship programs to support your growth and career development
Flexible working arrangements to support work-life balance
Well-stocked kitchen and team-building events like our famous pizza & beer Fridays
GetYourGuide vouchers and free German lessons
Relocation assistance if needed


And more...

We look forward to hearing from you

Unlock your full potential and join our mission to create unforgettable experiences for millions around the world. If you have the skills and passion for joining our team, we invite you to apply by submitting your CV/resume in English through the form below. Check out how we hire for tips and visibility into our process and check out life at GetYourGuide. If you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact us via jobs@getyourguide.com.

We are an equal opportunity employer

Our commitment is that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion. Please refrain from including your picture and age with the application.


Show more

Title: Senior Data Analyst (m/w/d)
Description:
Deine Mission

Wir suchen einen erfahrenen Senior Data Analyst, der komplexe Datensätze analysiert und aussagekräftige Erkenntnisse liefert, um strategische Entscheidungen zu unterstützen. Du arbeitest mit SQL, Python und Data-Visualization-Tools, um Datenprozesse zu optimieren und die Qualität des Reportings zu verbessern. Fundierte Kenntnisse in Cloud-Plattformen wie AWS oder GCP sind essenziell, ebenso wie Erfahrung mit Data Warehouses wie Snowflake oder BigQuery. Darüber hinaus arbeitest du eng mit cross-funktionalen Teams zusammen, unterstützt ETL-Workflows und nutzt dbt, um die Datenverarbeitung zu optimieren. Deine Fähigkeit, selbstständig zu arbeiten und dich in einem dynamischen Umfeld schnell anzupassen, ist entscheidend für den Erfolg in dieser Rolle.

Dein Profil


Fundierte Kenntnisse in SQL, Python und Data-Visualization-Tools (Tableau, Power BI, Looker).
Erfahrung mit Cloud-Plattformen wie AWS und/oder GCP.
Expertise in Data Warehouses wie Snowflake oder BigQuery.
Kenntnisse in ETL-Workflows, Datenbankmanagementsystemen und dbt (Data Build Tool).
Abgeschlossenes Studium in Informatik, Mathematik, Statistik oder einem verwandten Bereich.
Erfahrung im Finanzsektor ist von Vorteil, aber nicht erforderlich.


Über uns

Die Smartbroker-Gruppe betreibt unter anderem den Smartbroker+ – einen mehrfach ausgezeichneten Online-Broker, der als einziger Anbieter in Deutschland das umfangreiche Produktspektrum der klassischen Broker mit den äußerst günstigen Konditionen der Neobroker verbindet. Zum Portfolio gehört außerdem der digitale Fondsvermittler SMARTBROKER Finance (vormals: FondsDISCOUNT.de), gleichzeitig betreibt die Gruppe vier reichweitenstarke Börsenportale (wallstreet-online.de, boersenNews.de, FinanzNachrichten.de und ARIVA.de). Mit mehreren Hundert Millionen monatlichen Seitenaufrufen ist die Gruppe der größte verlagsunabhängige Finanzportalbetreiber im deutschsprachigen Raum und unterhält außerdem die größte Finanz-Community.

Das Unternehmen gehört zu den Pionieren des digitalen Investments. Seit mehr als 25 Jahren setzen wir uns dafür ein, die Hürden bei der Geldanlage abzubauen und eine nutzerfreundliche und preisgünstige Abwicklung von Investments zu ermöglichen.

Der Schlüssel zu diesem Erfolg sind unsere Mitarbeiter:innen. Aufgrund der starken Wachstumsdynamik haben wir in den vergangenen Jahren zahlreiche attraktive Arbeitsplätze geschaffen. Jeden Tag streben wir danach, das beste Team aufzubauen und unseren Mitarbeiter:innen den Raum zu geben, sich selbst bestmöglich zu entwickeln. Ein vielfältiges Team aus Leistungsträgern sorgt dafür, dass wir alle jeden Tag dazulernen. Aus einem kleinen Team mit ca. 20 Personen sind wir inzwischen ein Unternehmen mit rund 260 Mitarbeiter:innen (Stand 31.12.2023) geworden, das in einem modernen Büro in Berlin-Kreuzberg sitzt.

Wir verstehen uns als innovatives Fintech, das in eine erfolgreiche Unternehmensgruppe eingebettet ist und damit persönliche Arbeitsatmosphäre mit den Vorteilen einer finanzstarken Aktiengesellschaft verbindet. In allen Unternehmensteilen setzen wir auf flache Hierarchien, individuelle Entwicklung und agile Prozesse. Wir sind stolz auf den persönlichen Zusammenhalt im Team und die überdurchschnittlich lange Betriebszugehörigkeit vieler Angestellter. Wir setzen uns für Vielfalt und Chancengleichheit ein. Wir streben danach, ein Team aufzubauen, das eine Vielzahl von Hintergründen, Perspektiven und Fähigkeiten repräsentiert. Je integrativer wir sind, desto besser wird unsere Arbeit und unser Team sein.

Wenn auch du Teil dieses schnell wachsenden Unternehmens werden möchtest, dann bewirb dich jetzt bei der Smartbroker Gruppe.

Wir ermutigen Frauen, nicht-binäre und Transgender-Personen sowie alle Mitglieder der LGBTQI+-Community, Menschen mit marginalisiertem ethnischen Hintergrund und Menschen mit sichtbaren oder nicht sichtbaren Behinderungen, sich zu bewerben, wenn sie ein integratives, vielfältiges und sicheres Arbeitsumfeld suchen.
Show more

Title: Senior Data Analyst (f/m/x)
Description:
EMBRACE THE WORLD: HOP ON YOUR NEXT ADVENTURE WITH US!

We are a lively and diverse team, founded by our CEO Julian Weselek in 2016, currently active in the DACH region and France. Our ambition is to become the leading travel company for authentic, customized, multi-day trips while being mindful of our planet: we are the first travel company in the EU to set near-term carbon reduction targets approved by the Science Based Targets initiative (SBTi): this is an imperative step toward decarbonization. We are and always will be driving the change in the travel industry for a better tomorrow.

DESTINATION? THE WORLD!

We are discoverers. We are believers in the life-changing power of travel. On our journey we've built the amazing team that we have today - a team that sets the ambition to be remembered for building the future of travel, for consistently changing the norms of the industry and, simply, for staying true to our passion for bringing together the cultures of the world.

What is the role about?


Ultimately, we work to create the best experience in travel, using data to improve our customer experience and our product, increase our marketing reach, and optimize our costs
Own data projects fully end to end. You will manage data pipelines, ensure data quality, model data in dbt, and put them into reports or visualizations in Looker
Bring ideas to life. We welcome prototyping solutions that generate impact right away
Work as one team with Data Engineers, Data Scientists, Data Analysts, and business users to maintain and improve our data infrastructure
The Tools We Use:
Warehousing and ELT: Snowflake, dbt, SQL
Visualisation: Looker (LookML)
Data Sources and Importing Tools: Salesforce, Internal Applications, Event Data, Fivetran and Airbyte
Ad-Hoc Analysis: SQL, R, Python



What will you need to be successful?


You are proficient in SQL and bring previous experience in data analytics, data science, business intelligence, or a related field. We welcome applicants with an academic background
You have knowledge of statistics - using statistical concepts in testing, modeling, and forecasting
You have a strong business mindset and you are able to communicate data topics to non-technical stakeholders
You are able to work independently and have a problem-solving mindset
You like to collaborate with your colleagues. You ask colleagues when you’re stuck and help them out when they are. You discuss ideas and challenges



YOU ARE THE WORLD


We value your participation in Tourlane's success and complement your cash compensation with a package of employee stock options (ESOP)
Flexible working setup to get the most of your working hours: we offer full flexibility in our Hybrid/Remote model, however we do expect that you take advantage of our lively Berlin office 2-3 days per week
We share your passion for traveling: enjoy working abroad through our new program
Your wellbeing matters to us: we offer mindfulness classes to take care of your mental health, sessions with Nilo.health
We support all the diverse communities that make us Tourlane: join or create your own Employee Resource Group (ERG) and connect with Tourlaneans
Dog-friendly office: we can’t wait to meet your furry friend!



Sounds interesting? We are excited to get to know you!

Data privacy policy.
Show more

What is the role about?

  • Ultimately, we work to create the best experience in travel, using data to improve our customer experience and our product, increase our marketing reach, and optimize our costs
  • Own data projects fully end to end. You will manage data pipelines, ensure data quality, model data in dbt, and put them into reports or visualizations in Looker
  • Bring ideas to life. We welcome prototyping solutions that generate impact right away
  • Work as one team with Data Engineers, Data Scientists, Data Analysts, and business users to maintain and improve our data infrastructure
  • The Tools We Use:
    • Warehousing and ELT: Snowflake, dbt, SQL
    • Visualisation: Looker (LookML)
    • Data Sources and Importing Tools: Salesforce, Internal Applications, Event Data, Fivetran and Airbyte
    • Ad-Hoc Analysis: SQL, R, Python


What will you need to be successful?

  • You are proficient in SQL and bring previous experience in data analytics, data science, business intelligence, or a related field. We welcome applicants with an academic background
  • You have knowledge of statistics - using statistical concepts in testing, modeling, and forecasting
  • You have a strong business mindset and you are able to communicate data topics to non-technical stakeholders
  • You are able to work independently and have a problem-solving mindset
  • You like to collaborate with your colleagues. You ask colleagues when you’re stuck and help them out when they are. You discuss ideas and challenges


YOU ARE THE WORLD

  • We value your participation in Tourlane's success and complement your cash compensation with a package of employee stock options (ESOP)
  • Flexible working setup to get the most of your working hours: we offer full flexibility in our Hybrid/Remote model, however we do expect that you take advantage of our lively Berlin office 2-3 days per week
  • We share your passion for traveling: enjoy working abroad through our new program
  • Your wellbeing matters to us: we offer mindfulness classes to take care of your mental health, sessions with Nilo.health
  • We support all the diverse communities that make us Tourlane: join or create your own Employee Resource Group (ERG) and connect with Tourlaneans
  • Dog-friendly office: we can’t wait to meet your furry friend!


Sounds interesting? We are excited to get to know you!

Data privacy policy.

Title: Market Intelligence Specialist (m/f/d)
Description:
Requisition Number: 64998

Corning is vital to progress – in the industries we help shape and in the world we share.

We invent life-changing technologies using materials science. Our scientific and manufacturing expertise, boundless curiosity, and commitment to purposeful invention place us at the center of the way the world interacts, works, learns, and lives.

Our sustained investment in research, development, and invention means we’re always ready to solve the toughest challenges alongside our customers.

Our Optical Communications segment has recently evolved from being a manufacturer of optical fiber and cable, hardware and equipment to being a comprehensive provider of industry-leading optical solutions across the broader communications industry.This segment is classified into two main product groupings – carrier network and enterprise network. The carrier network product group consists primarily of products and solutions for optical-based communications infrastructure for services such as video, data and voice communications. The enterprise network product group consists primarily of optical-based communication networks sold to businesses, governments and individuals for their own use.

For our Berlin Headquarter (or Strykow, Poland) we are currently looking for a

Market Intelligence Specialist (m/f/d)

Responsibilities


Analyze news quickly to uncover and disseminate meaningful insights on market landscape.
Analyze the impact of new market and competitive developments affecting Corning.
Support the EMEA MI OCS Lead in ad-hoc MI projects.
Support maintenance of MI knowledge sharing platform and mobile app. Structure, organize and maintain MI content architecture to maximize customer experience and utility. Scope covers training, marketing campaigns, leveraging usage analytics, troubleshooting, driving collaborative platform to build and exchange rich MI insights.
Strengthen linkages between the MI Team and COC’s Commercial and Business Intelligence Teams to enhance MI collaboration.
Maintain and disseminate competitor one-pagers. Collaborate with COC and MI team to chronicle key events and articulate business implications.
Monitor intelligence sources (e.g. competitors’ web sites) and assist OCS Strategy Team in compiling daily and weekly English-language market intelligence communications.
Measure usage of these market intelligence communications with quantitative statistics; use to drive continuous improvement.
Conduct secondary market research to gather relevant information from a variety of sources and integrate into competitive and market intelligence projects.
Support administrative tasks related to MI newsletters platform (create new MI newsletters, maintain search taxonomy, resolve technical issues); collaborate with external MI software provider; maintain MI Share Point and Box sites/content; maintain MI Team’s e-mail box, distribution lists, etc.
Conduct comparative analysis for competitors vs. Corning EMEA (e.g. manufacturing costs, product costs, financial analysis).


Requirements


Bachelor’s degree in Data Analytics, Finance or relevant field required. Master’s degree in Business Intelligence or Business Administration preferred.
Previous relevant job experience in Market Research, Competitive + Market Intelligence and/or Data Analytics.
Minimum 2-3 years of work experience, preferably in the telecom industry.
Strong knowledge of Market Intelligence related processes.
Good understanding of Corning Optical Communications product portfolio, target markets as well as our competitors and customers' landscape.
Fluent in English, written and spoken. Polish language skills are a benefit.
Structured and analytical thinker with excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Sound understanding of the Microsoft Office suite, especially Excel.
Quick learner; persistent, takes initiative, determined, resilient.
Experience with Power BI and AI desired.


Workplaces


Berlin, Germany or Strykow, Poland. Hybrid working conditions (2 days per week at home and 3 days in the office).


We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. To request an accommodation, please contact us at accommodations@corning.com .

Title: Data Analyst (m/w/d)
Description:
Werde Teil eines innovativen Teams bei Education Partners als “Data Analyst” (m/w/d)




Bist du begeistert von der Macht der Daten und möchtest entscheidende Einblicke liefern, die den Unternehmenserfolg vorantreiben? Education Partners, ein führendes Unternehmen im Bereich der transformativen Bildung, gestaltet das Lernen und Wachsen neu. Mit aktuell 12 hochmodernen Akademien in ganz Europa treiben wir Innovationen in der digitalen Bildung voran.




Was wir bieten:

Hybrides Arbeitsmodell: Genieße die Flexibilität, sowohl von zu Hause als auch in unserem modernen Büro im Herzen Berlins zu arbeiten.
Modernste Technologie-Umgebung: Nutze die neuesten Datenanalyse-Tools und Business Intelligence-Lösungen in einem dynamischen Umfeld.
Wirkungsvolle Arbeit: Deine Analysen und Insights beeinflussen direkt die strategischen Entscheidungen.
Berufliche Weiterentwicklung: Wir fördern kontinuierliches Lernen durch Zugang zu Workshops, Konferenzen und erstklassigen Weiterbildungsangeboten.
Attraktives Gesamtpaket: Profitiere von 30 Tagen Urlaub, einem Remote-First-Ansatz, modernster Hardware und einem wettbewerbsfähigen Gehalt.




Dein Impact:

Datenanalyse & Insights: Du analysierst große und komplexe Datensätze, um wertvolle Insights zu gewinnen, die unser Verständnis von Kundenverhalten, Markttrends und Geschäftsentwicklungen vertiefen.
Dashboard- & Reporting-Erstellung: Du entwickelst aussagekräftige Dashboards und Berichte, um datenbasierte Entscheidungen zu erleichtern – idealerweise mit Power BI oder vergleichbaren Tools.
Datengetriebene Prozessoptimierung: Du identifizierst Potenziale zur Verbesserung interner Prozesse und unterstützt die Fachbereiche dabei, datenbasierte Strategien umzusetzen.
Zusammenarbeit mit Fachabteilungen: Du arbeitest eng mit Teams aus Marketing, Produkt und Business Development zusammen, um operative sowie strategische Maßnahmen zu steuern.
Tracking & Datenqualität: Du stellst sicher, dass relevante Daten zuverlässig erfasst werden. Dafür unterstützt du bei der Implementierung von Tracking- und Analyse-Tools wie Google Analytics und Google Tag Manager.
Automatisierung & Skalierung: Du optimierst Datenprozesse, entwickelst Automatisierungen und sorgst für eine effiziente Nutzung der verfügbaren Datenquellen.




Was wir suchen:

Analytische Denkweise & datengetriebenes Mindset: Du hast ein ausgeprägtes Gespür für Daten, erfasst komplexe Zusammenhänge schnell und übersetzt diese in präzise Handlungsempfehlungen.
Tools: Du bist sicher im Umgang mit SQL und Excel/Google Sheets und kannst große Datensätze effizient analysieren und verarbeiten.
Erfahrung mit Datenvisualisierung: Du kennst Dich mit Tools wie Power BI, Tableau oder Looker aus und erstellst Dashboards und Berichte, die wichtige KPIs verständlich darstellen (Power BI bevorzugt).
Kenntnisse in Tracking & Web Analytics: Idealerweise hast Du Erfahrung mit Google Analytics und Google Tag Manager (GTM) und weißt, wie man Nutzerverhalten richtig auswertet.
Teamplayer & Kommunikationsstärke: Du arbeitest gerne mit verschiedenen Fachabteilungen zusammen und kannst komplexe Daten verständlich präsentieren – auch für Nicht-Analysten.
Startup-Mentalität & Eigeninitiative: Du fühlst dich in dynamischen Umfeldern wohl, übernimmst Verantwortung und treibst datengetriebene Projekte eigenständig voran.
Sprachkenntnisse: Fließende Deutschkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift sind für diese Rolle erforderlich.

Nice-to-Have:

Erfahrung im Marketing oder Performance Marketing und ein Verständnis für datengetriebene Marketingstrategien.
Erfahrung mit Automatisierung und Skalierung von Datenprozessen.
Kenntnisse in der Anwendung von Machine Learning oder Predictive Analytics sind ein Plus.




Werde Teil unseres Teams und hilf dabei, die Zukunft des Lernens zu gestalten, indem du fundierte datengetriebene Entscheidungen ermöglicht, die unsere Geschäftsstrategie maßgeblich beeinflussen.

  • Erfahrung mit Automatisierung und Skalierung von Datenprozessen.
  • Kenntnisse in der Anwendung von Machine Learning oder Predictive Analytics sind ein Plus.


Werde Teil unseres Teams und hilf dabei, die Zukunft des Lernens zu gestalten, indem du fundierte datengetriebene Entscheidungen ermöglicht, die unsere Geschäftsstrategie maßgeblich beeinflussen.

Title: Market Intelligence Analyst for Poland (w/m/d)
Description:
Our Renewables Team in Berlin and/or Stettin is looking for you!

Deine Aufgaben


Vertiefung des Verständnisses des Teams für aktuelle und erwartete Marktentwicklungen, regulatorische Rahmenbedingungen, einschließlich Beschreibungen der wichtigsten Auktionsmechanismen, Entwicklung von Auktionsprognosen und Herausforderungen (z. B. Kürzung)
Förderung der Marktexpertise mit dem Ziel, alle erforderlichen Beiträge für den Strategieüberprüfungsprozess des Unternehmens sowie für seine Arbeit an LCOEs bereitzustellen
Überwachung und Analyse der Aktivitäten der Wettbewerber und der Marktbedingungen, die für die Branche der erneuerbaren Energien spezifisch sind, um die strategische Planung zu informieren, neue Möglichkeiten zu identifizieren und Positionierungsstrategien nach Bedarf anzupassen
Überprüfung interner und externer Preisprognosen und Kennzeichnung potenzieller Risiken
Entwicklung einer Meinung zu PPAs zusammen mit dem Input des Trading-Teams von Uniper
Möglichkeit, Verständnis für andere Märkte für erneuerbare Energien zu entwickeln und bei der Identifizierung von Markteintrittsoptionen zu helfen
Arbeite mit funktionsübergreifenden Teams zusammen, einschließlich, aber nicht beschränkt auf Projektentwicklung, EPCO, kommerzielle Analyse, Marktanalyse, um die Position des Unternehmens im Land zu verbessern


Dein Profil


Abgeschlossenes Hochschulstudium der Betriebswirtschaftslehre, Volkswirtschaftslehre, Wirtschaftsingenieurwesen, Wirtschaftsrecht oder vergleichbares Studium
2 - 5 Jahre einschlägige Berufserfahrung
Expertise in den Märkten für Strom und erneuerbare Energien, Preisgestaltungssysteme sowie regulatorische Vergütungssysteme und das Bestreben, den Übergang zu erneuerbaren Energien zu unterstützen
Ausgeprägtes analytisches, strategisches, unternehmerisches Denken, kombiniert mit einem wissbegierigen Geist
Leichtigkeit und Interesse, Fähigkeiten im Projektmanagement zu entwickeln, Stakeholder kollaborativ einzubinden und neue Herausforderungen anzunehmen
Kreativer und aufgeschlossener Mensch mit einem guten Sinn für Humor
Verhandlungssichere Kenntnisse in Polnisch und Englisch (weitere Sprachen willkommen)


Our Renewables Team in Berlin and/or Stettin is looking for you!

Title: Senior Data Analyst Marketing (f/m/x)
Description:
The role

As a Senior Data Analyst in the Marketing Analytics team, you will join the wider International Marketing Analytics. Your main focus will be on supporting your communication platform product team stakeholders which supports global CRM communications in HelloFresh in their decision making. You will be their key contact person regarding data and analytics questions. Your experience in analytics and related technologies, together with your excellent communication, stakeholder management and organisational skills will have a big impact on the company’s performance.

Above all, we are looking for people who will make HelloFresh better. We believe there are many different ways of developing skills and we love diverse experiences! So even if you don’t “tick all the boxes” but think you’d thrive in this role, we would really like to learn more about you.

What You’ll Do


Collaborate with Product and Commercial Leads in order to understand the strategic priorities for your domain and then execute against these with engaging work
Partner closely with the Product and Marketing organisation promoting a culture rooted in evidence-based decision making.
Communicate actionable insights clearly across the organisation highlighting the “so-whats” of your analyses in order to drive the growth of our business.
Explore and analyse customer behaviour, communication engagement and product performance data in order to detect growth opportunities for the HelloFresh digital product by improving user experience.


What You’ll Bring


Strong experience in quantitative analysis roles, ideally including having worked closely with product teams
Technical Expertise: Proficient in advanced SQL and foundational statistical tests.
Data Visualization Mastery: advanced knowledge of Tableau for crafting compelling visualisations that effectively communicate complex data
Analytical Confidence: Confidence in performing analysis with large datasets while avoiding the common pitfalls
Holistic Analytical Approach: Blend of analytical and critical thinking, complemented by strong presentation and communication skills
Outcome-Driven Professional: Results-oriented with the ability to transform problem statements into actionable analytical insights. Skilled at aligning stakeholders to implement actions that bring value to both the business and its customers
BI and A/B Testing Exposure: Familiarity with Business Intelligence (BI) tools and experience in A/B testing and analytics platforms, including Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, Optimizely, MixPanel, etc.


What We Offer

Elevate your lifestyle! Join one of Europe's fastest-growing tech powerhouses in a dynamic phase of expansion.


Immerse yourself in a diverse global community of 90+ nationalities.
Enjoy a competitive compensation package that goes beyond the norm, with perks like a HelloFresh- subsidized Pension Scheme, Berlin relocation support, and a Hybrid working model.
Elevate your lifestyle with exclusive discounts on your weekly HelloFresh box and office meals.
Invest in your growth with an annual learning & development budget, German language learning budget, and access to the HelloFresh Academy.
Plus, we've got your well-being covered with mental health support, transportation perks, and working-parent-friendly benefits. From our 24/7 gym access,wellbeing platforms like Headspace and Spill, to sabbatical leave options, HelloFresh is not just a workplace; it's a lifestyle of perks and possibilities!


Are you up for the challenge?

Please submit your complete application below including your salary expectations and earliest starting date.

After submitting an application our team will review this and get back to you within 5 business days.

JR102678

Title: Performance Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
Company Description

Flink is the leading quick commerce player in Europe. We are on a mission to give people back time: You can order your groceries through our app and we deliver to your doorstep in minutes. We carry 2,500 products with focus on the leading brands in each category. We aim for sustainability by making deliveries on electric bikes and utilizing recyclable packaging.

Flink launched in February 2021 and already operates in more than 80 cities in Germany, the Netherlands and France. The business generated more than EUR 400m in revenues in 2022 and is operationally profitable. Flink is backed by the world’s most renowned tech investors, including Prosus, Mubadala and Bond and strategic investors like Doordash and REWE. We take great pride in being an inclusive employer that offers equal opportunities, and we celebrate the diversity and multiculturalism of our team. We're growing fast and always pushing ourselves to do better - we play for #1.

Job Description


Provide data-driven insights to support management in resource planning and strategic decision-making.
Analyze historical data and trends to identify areas for improvement in forecasting accuracy and staffing efficiency.
Create detailed reports and dashboards to communicate forecast accuracy, staffing metrics, and actionable insights.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather input and ensure alignment in planning processes.


Qualifications


Bachelor in data analysis/data science/IT or Economics.
Analytical mindset, ability to interpret and translate data into actionable insights
Advanced knowledge of SQL and Microsoft Excel
Other programming languages are a plus (e.g. Python, Java, JavaScript etc)
Excellent written and spoken communication in English and German
Willingness to relocate to Berlin


Additional Information


A €1000 annual L&D budget as well as individual coaching options to ensure you have plenty of opportunities to learn, grow and achieve your goals.
26 days of vacation, +1 day every year up to a maximum of 30 days.
A mobility budget of 30 EUR per month with NAVIT, which you can use individually for Uber, BVG and many other providers.
A cool discount on your Urban Sports Club membership.
Attractive company pension options.
Unlimited access to an e-learning and development platform, MyAcademy, including online German courses.
Online discounts with Corporate Benefits and Future Bens.
A cool discount off your personal Flink orders; be the first to test out new products!
A modern and dog-friendly office in the heart of Berlin - lots of delicious lunch spots available within short walking distance.


It is our commitment that every applicant will be evaluated according to their skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion.

We carry 2,500 products with focus on the leading brands in each category. We aim for sustainability by making deliveries on electric bikes and utilizing recyclable packaging.

Title: Senior BI Analyst
Description:
Why us?

RABOT Energy is looking for a Senior BI Analyst to take our data insights to the next level. With our fast company and consumer growth, the demand for high-quality insights rises across the company., We are looking for an experienced analyst to join our BI team and become a trusted partner for our stakeholders. This role will be key in delivering actionable insights that drive strategic decision-making across all departments.

Your Impact


Design and develop BI solutions, dashboards, and reports to provide meaningful insights to business stakeholders.
Play a key role in structuring and defining our Data Warehouse to ensure scalability and data integrity.
Guide and mentor team members and peers, providing technical QA and ensuring best practices in data visualization and reporting.
Analyze complex datasets and translate them into clear, strategic recommendations for leadership and cross-functional teams.
Work closely with different departments to understand data needs, ensuring insights are accessible and impactful for decision-making.


What Can You Bring


Professional Experience: Proven track record in designing and developing BI solutions, dashboards, and reports together with top-tier-stakeholders.
Technical Expertise: Advanced proficiency in BI tools (e.g., Metabase, Power BI, Tableau, Qlik, Looker).
SQL Mastery: Strong SQL skills for data extraction, manipulation, and optimization.
Data Warehousing & ETL: Experience working with data warehouses, dbt, ETL processes, and big data technologies.
Analytical Mindset: Ability to analyze large and complex datasets, extract key insights, and drive data-informed decisions.
Clear Communication: Ability to present complex data insights in an understandable way to senior management and non-technical teams.
Language Skills: Fluent in English. Knowledge of German is a plus


Lacking experience in some of the areas mentioned? No need for concern – we are committed to providing you with the necessary support for learning, training, and on-the-job coaching

Our Benefits


Enjoy flexible working hours and the freedom to work remotely 2 days a week, offering you a work-life balance that suits your lifestyle.
We're committed to your growth. Benefit from comprehensive training, regular team meetings, and open, transparent communication to keep you informed and engaged.
Maintain your physical well-being with an Urban Sports Club membership that offers you a world of fitness opportunities.
Immerse yourself in a vibrant startup atmosphere, where a spirited team, exciting team events, and our 'Employees Recruit Employees' program await you – your path to rewarding success.
Celebrate the holidays with peace of mind, as you'll always have Christmas Eve and New Year's Eve off to make cherished memories.
28 Vacation days
Workation: Enjoy two weeks of workation per year and work from anywhere in the EU


For all our positions, we are open to providing flexible work arrangements to accommodate the unique needs of each individual.

About Us

RABOT Energy is an independent supplier of 100 % renewable energy, offering dynamic electricity tariffs to private and business customers. Our innovative approach involves just-in-time buying strategies at the energy exchange, ensuring both ecological sustainability and cost optimization for domestic charging management. By passing on exchange buying prices to our customers, we can save them up to 35 % on their electricity bills. Electric vehicle owners particularly benefit from our dynamic electricity tariff, as we have developed a smart system that signals the car when to automatically charge during periods of low electricity prices. And this is just the beginning!

Our mission is to empower every consumer to efficiently manage their energy consumption costs while safeguarding the environment and natural resources. Through our provision of 100% renewable energy and comprehensive smart charging and energy management solutions for homes (including integrated PV systems, battery storage, and heat pumps), RABOT Charge actively contributes to increasing the real green power share in Germany's electricity consumption, thus driving the energy transition forward. We were recently awarded the top spot by efahrer.com amongst dynamic electricity tariff providers. We are on a rapid growth trajectory and accordingly scaling our marketing and brand teams.

"Be part of something unique, the first of its kind in Germany. Join us at RABOT Charge and seize abundant growth opportunities in the thriving world of green energy. We're a team that believes in the power of our mission, and we're looking for individuals with the passion to match ours!”

Jan Rabe, CEO

At RABOT Charge, we cherish cognitive diversity as a cornerstone of our global culture and a driving force behind our mission to craft truly representative and impactful products for a sustainable future. We wholeheartedly embrace diversity in all its dimensions and recognize that each person contributes to our shared endeavour of assisting individuals in transitioning to green energy.
Show more

Title: B2B Data Analyst (all genders)
Description:
Was wir suchen ...



Zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt suchen wir einen B2B Data Analyst (all genders), der nicht nur Zahlen analysiert, sondern auch die richtigen Schlüsse zieht, Trends erkennt und neue Möglichkeiten aufzeigt. Wenn du Lust hast, mit deinem Daten-Know-how Prozesse zu optimieren, smarte Prognosen zu erstellen und unser B2B-Business aufs nächste Level zu bringen, dann freuen wir uns, von dir zu hören.

Wichtig: Für diese Position sind Deutschkenntnisse mindestens auf B2-Niveau ein Muss.



Deine Aufgaben



Du analysierst interne und externe Datenquellen und findest die relevanten Insights.
Du erstellst Forecasts, Demand Plannings und Co., damit alle wissen, wo die Reise hingeht.
Du beantwortest Fragen des B2B-Teams, testest Hypothesen und ziehst proaktiv Schlüsse aus den Daten – immer mit Blick auf konkrete Handlungsempfehlungen.
Du nutzt vorhandene Daten, um Vorhersagen zu möglichen Kampagnen-Ergebnissen zu treffen.
Du baust eine neue Datenstruktur auf, die alle notwendigen Standard-Reportings enthält – gemeinsam mit dem Team legst du fest, wie maximale Transparenz und Sichtbarkeit erreicht werden können.
Du identifizierst Geschäftsmöglichkeiten: Sei es durch das Erkennen von Marketing- und Kampagnentrends, die Verbesserung interner Prozesse oder durch den Einsatz datengetriebener Plattformen, die Vertriebsaktivitäten transparenter machen





Dein Profil



fundierte Erfahrung im Bereich Datenanalyse und Business Intelligence (BI)
umfangreiche Kenntnisse in mathematischen und statistischen Analysen sowie den entsprechenden Tools
schnelle Auffassungsgabe zur Übersetzung komplexer Anforderungen in konkrete Aufgaben
service- und lösungsorientierte Arbeitsweise mit einer Balance aus Perfektionismus und Pragmatismus
visionäre Denkweise, um Innovationen voranzutreiben und das B2B-Geschäft weiterzuentwickeln
Sicherstellung von Datenintegrität und -genauigkeit sowie Optimierung von Datenprozessen
Erfahrung mit Excel, SQL, Tableau, Power BI und Programmierung in Python oder R
Fähigkeit, komplexe Datenanalysen in umsetzbare Erkenntnisse für Entscheidungsträger zu übersetzen
akademischer Abschluss in einem betriebswirtschaftlichen Fachbereich oder vergleichbare Berufserfahrungen






Warum wir?



Wir sind ein motiviertes Team mit echtem Zusammenhalt – wir unterstützen einander.
Du wirst schnell ein fester Teil unseres Teams und kannst deine Ideen jederzeit einbringen.
Für alles, was deinen Job einfacher oder flexibler macht, bekommst du ein Budget.
Flexible Arbeitszeiten und Home-Office? Machen wir möglich – ganz unkompliziert in Absprache.
28 Urlaubstage warten auf dich – und jedes Jahr bei uns gibt’s einen extra Tag obendrauf (bis max. 30).
Stell dir jeden Monat Gutscheine im Wert von 50 Euro zusammen – bei vielen spannenden Partner*innen.
Dein Deutschland-Ticket? Das übernehmen wir für dich!
Nutze unseren Zugang zu OpenUp für anonyme, professionelle Unterstützung - für deine mentale Gesundheit.
Regelmäßige Team-Aktivitäten, ob im Office oder draußen, gehören bei uns dazu.
Teste Produktneuheiten und Trends, bevor sie auf den Markt kommen.
Sichere dir exklusive Rabatte auf unser Sortiment und viele weitere Vorteile mit Corporate Benefits.
Modernes Arbeiten mit Apple-Produkten und einem funktionalen Arbeitsplatz ist bei uns Standard.





Du willst dich bewerben? Dann los!



Schicke uns deinen Lebenslauf sowie ein kurzes Anschreiben unter der Angabe deiner Gründe, warum DU unser Perfect Match bist.

Wir freuen uns auf deine Bewerbung!



Über uns



Als Beauty-Onlineshop bringen wir deine liebsten Produkte kuratierter Marken aus den USA, UK & Co. nach Deutschland und sehen uns dabei auch als Sprungbrett für kleine, noch wachsende Beauty-Brands.

Denn neben unserer Präsenz als Beauty-Onlineshop arbeiten wir hinter den Kulissen auch als Distributor für innovative Marken aus dem Ausland. Dazu gehören Geek & Gorgeous, RevitaLash und The Fox Tan, denen wir neue Zugänge zu bekannten Retailern in Europa eröffnen.

Dabei legen wir mit unserem diversen, jungen Team aus rund 50 Mitarbeitenden den Fokus auf ganzheitliche Marketingkonzepte, um Tag für Tag das Beauty-Game in der DACH-Region weiter zu revolutionieren. Das macht unsere Arbeit weltweit einzigartig und besonders abwechslungsreich.

Die PURISH GmbH fördert aktiv eine Kultur der Wertschätzung von Vielfalt. Daher begrüßen wir Bewerbungen von People of Color, Menschen aller Nationalitäten, Religionen und Weltanschauungen, sexueller Orientierungen und geschlechtlicher Identitäten sowie aller Altersgruppen und möglichen Einschränkungen.

Wir ermutigen alle, sich bei uns zu bewerben!

Show more
